Reviews.Title: “Really lacking customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Chefrs
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at 11am and we were told that the room was not cleaned yet and we would have to wait until 2pm to get the room! This was bad considering we just got off an international flight to Madrid and just wanted to rest, not go out into the city. We were offered nothing for this wait to get the room, not even a bottle of water at the bar! Our room was facing the street and was kinda loud at night. The worst thing was that we did not discover there was free WiFi until the last day of our stay. They offer internet access for 9Euro / day in room and we thought that included WiFi but it did not. So ask for a WiFi code at the front desk if you do stay there. Room was clean and very modern. Beds are really hard! Location is great, but the service could be much better for a four star establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful service”
Reviews.Author: Dennis R
Reviews.Content: This hotel appears modern at first however the hotel has a strange layout unless staying in a room that faces the street. Our first room was directly next to the elevator door. We weren't too keen on having that room so we immediately asked to swap rooms. The lady was not friendly and she made it seem like I had done something wrong. The next room was very warm until we realised late at night that the heater in the bathroom was on and couldn't be turned off! After calling the reception, they sent an employee to look at it, however he couldn't speak English! They called me later saying they turned the heater off for the whole hotel which we found out wasn't true. The next morning after an uncomfortable night's sleep we complained to the reception again and, again no one could speak English until the manager came. I'll say he was quite helpful and apologetic and gave us another new room (3rd one) which was one of the street front ones. The hotel is quite modern but I can tell it has been renovated on the surface and they have added such as things as new lights, bedding, tiles, etc. The location is quite good. It would be better if they had more English speaking staff and the staff took guests concerns more seriously and not as if they are annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & location, rooms seem to involve a tradeoff”
Reviews.Author: JerkyLlama
Reviews.Content: I was put up at the Vincci Centrum for a short conference in Madrid and overall had a relatively enjoyable experience but one that left me with mixed emotions. The hotel is in a nice location, just a short walk from Puerta del Sol, Santa Ana square, the Prado Museum area, and Retiro Park. The staff was very nice and welcoming, doing such things as making dinner reservations at a nice place nearby and being very polite and helpful during the tasty breakfast buffet. In talking to other guests who attended my conference and stayed at this hotel, the rooms seemed to entail a bit of a tradeoff. There appear to be some rooms such as mine which feel quite spacious and have nice natural light, but are facing the busy street and are honestly quite noisy with street noise. I had an important presentation one morning and was up half the night before due to the noise from traffic, horns and sirens, and the jarring click-clack of cars frequently running over what must be a loose manhole cover. I'm usually a deep sleeper, but falling asleep took so long that at 1:30am I was *this* close to going down to the lobby to try to get a quieter room to get some rest before my important 9am presentation (for which I faced the double whammy of being jetlagged for anyway). In talking with other guests, it seems that the rooms off the street are much quieter, but feel smaller and darker. So depending on your preferences, be aware of this fact. Also, in my own experience and in talking to other guests, the in-room internet connection was a bit erratic at best. Overall, a nice place ... I just wish the windows were more soundproof and the internet connection more consistent given the price (about 140 euros a night in late May ... not ridiculous, but also not cheap either). The room itself, service, and the location would merit 4~4.5 stars ... but the poor sleep quality make me rate my experience at 3 stars and would have me looking for another location to stay the next time I return to this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent rooms, very clean.”
Reviews.Author: Tom P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mainly due to its location, it's close to the main areas we wanted to visit (museums, Sol square, restaurants etc). The rooms were fairly small but nicely done out and the bathrooms were also smart. The cleaning staff were all very good and so were the staff on reception. Room service prices were reasonable although we didn't use it - too many good restaurants nearby. Views weren't amazing but again, we were out and about in the city so that didn't matter. The only things that could easily improve this hotel would be a bar and more than one iron. Most people end up with creased clothes when they have been on a plane and when we asked for an iron, they said that there was only one and it was being used. We had to wait for it then someone else wanted it. And it wasn't a good iron or ironing board. Apart from that, it's an ideal spot.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: guiukmaster
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel for anybody viisting Madrid, specially in a business trip. The service is really good, the personnel is quite friendly whose understand customer expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location close to Plaza de Santa Ana and its restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Kr1st11na
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in the end of September 2011 for 4 nights, as it was located within a short walk from the museum district (Museo del Prado, Centro de Arte Reina Sofía, Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum of Art, CaixaForum, etc). Didn't realize it beforehand but the hotel staff pointed out the nearby restaurant area surrounding Plaza de Santa Ana with numerous excellent outdoor restaurants and bars, so we were literally eating out every night in late September. The hotel itself was recently renovated and clean. It seems the doubles were all located inside the building block so our tiny window was facing a wall, but on the other hand it was also very quiet. The rooms were a bit dark, and the airconditioning very strong. Having a view from the window and getting rid of the abandoned construction site next door would have earned the fourth star for this hotel, but in general our stay was a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely food, rooms very dark”
Reviews.Author: IL0veNature
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for business in November 2011. The reception is ok. Lunch was excellent. Meeting rooms a bit dark, but decent. Could do with some more regular service of water and coffee. Rooms are also dark, but have a nice layout and design. Bathroom is too dark with the brown wash basins and dark tile. Wireless is not available everywhere and can be a challenge.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Modern Hotel but ,,,,”
Reviews.Author: dpe156
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vincci Centrum for two nights. The hotel ia well located within an easy walk of fabulous tapas restaurants and wine bars. The hotel is modern and looks the part but the rooms are tiny, lack wireless internet and my bathroom (and my colleauges on another floor) was dank and smelly. I made the mistake of opening the door to freshen the bathroom only to find the smell just spread to the room. Suspect an issue of poor ventilation. An acceptable place to stay but only if you can accept dank bathrooms. The location is great and it was reasonable price so....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: anthony b
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, contemporary hotel right in the heart of Madrid. Room was small, but well appointed. Lobby/restaurant was simple, but breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: sydcarnie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located near grand via and also close to metro stop so very good location for seeing the sites of Madrid. The hotel itself seemed to have been refurbished so rooms very clean and very spacious. There was a kitchenette in the room, which would have been helpful, however, you had to hire cutlery and plates at a reception which seemed a tad over the top. There was free Internet in reception, the staff were very helpful in pointing out directions and there was parking onsite. There was breakfast at the hotel, which I did not have but seemed to be ample and popular with othe guests. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet”
Reviews.Author: jbvhyugyuh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location being within walking distance of Peurto del Sol and Plaza Mayor. Our room was also very quiet as our room was facing another building and not the street. The room was a little small but we didn't need much room anyway as we only used it for sleeping. We also enjoyed that we could connect our laptop to the internet through an ethernet cable for free.

Reviews.Title: “Down Grade to 3 Star”
Reviews.Author: baltizaar
Reviews.Content: After managing 5 star hotels and boutique Inns for the last 16 years its not often I write a review but this experience has to be noted for the welfare of fellow guests. Upon first arrival it was difficult to see the hotel entrance as the building to the left is dwarfed in scaffolding which, judging by the graffiti/posters and pigeon excrement covering the side walk, is an old demolition site gone bust. Not the hotels fault, however the path should be kept clean for health reasons let alone guest perception. Upon entering the building, everything was very dark, the wood paneling, the lighting and floors. As we stood puzzled trying to ascertain where the reception was, we where overcome by the stench of raw sewage. The female front desk clerk gave no welcome other than "an unfriendly" do you need a room. We both speak Spanish, but continued the conversation in English, "actually we have a booking". NB> upon last minute research with Trip Advisor, I had sent 3 forms of communication. An email to booking.com, whom clarified the information, another to the hotel reception and also telephoned the hotel to make sure we had a quiet room away from the elevator and a view as my partner suffers badly from claustrophobia. With no mention of the sewage smell I had to ask and she abruptly snipped it wasn't the hotels fault it was the area and it was being dealt with. We entered the room and sure enough, a small, stale smelling room, window looking out onto a brick wall and 3m away from elevator, opposite the cleaning closet. Hastily back at reception, I pointed out we had been given everything I had specifically NOT asked for. She said, its all we have and insisted the room was not close to the elevator. I said its 3m away I measured it, she argued it wasn't! She continued to reprimand me, that they do not read the guest requests when I had asked why we were not informed my requests couldn't be met. I was so disturbed by her insolence and Yes, from the moment we stepped into this property we wanted to leave. We were now given a smoking room, both being non smokers, on the first floor directly above the entrance and views to the scaffolding. The smoke stained off white curtain had an old dark coffee stain that had been there some time and throughout the room and hotel the dark cheap wood paneling was chipped and scratched with no signs of repair and black scuff marks on the white wall areas. I had read in previous reviews that the hotel was on a quiet street and that there were no TV channels in English. They do have 6 channels in English, however only one works - CNN Africa and again I was told by the same unfriendly receptionist it was being fixed. Judging by the jammed news report on each channel, this issue was obsolete. The sewage smell and the English TV channels typically remained unaltered after our 3 day visit. Regarding the street, which has daily tour buses driving down every hour was not my interpretation of quiet. The first morning I was abruptly awoken at 8am by the overnight desk clerk and a maintenance worker gossiping VERY loudly directly below our window. I asked them to please speak quieter and away from the hotel entrance. He glanced at his watch as if I was inconveniencing him, muttered something at me as the desk clerk moved him off to the side to finish smoking. Downstairs in the over priced breakfast area, every day were 10 newspapers. All Spanish, not one for any of the foreign guests. Early Sunday morning we left the hotel for breakfast, noticing someone had vomited against the main entrance wall and across the path. Upon returning late afternoon the vomit was still there and we immediately mentioned this to the same unfriendly female clerk. How many hotel staff had walked over this disgusting site to come into work that day? This hotel clearly is not 4 stars, with its thread-bare carpets; the permanent mat in the foyer entrance is so worn, its edges are dog-eared and its only a matter of time before an accident occurs. Every night as we entered the hotel, we passed through a cloud of smoke from the same front desk clerk smoking outside, below our window, the entrance littered with cigarette butts and not so much as a welcoming nod from him. The elevator is tiny for a hotel of this size and requires a great degree of patience in waiting for it to arrive, with mechanical failure to close the doors once we had max of 4 people inside. Now I'm quite sure Mr. Marcelo [--], the Hotel Manager will write to rationalize and maybe camouflage most of this review as chronicled with many other complaints, but I can only encourage he pay careful attention to my honest and objective review, in the hopes of making it more hospitable to foreigners who have traveled far and at great cost to stay. I will also forward on this review to the CEO of the hotel chain. On the up side: Marco the Front desk manager is very kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed/Health Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Zack W
Reviews.Content: I had a very difficult time with this hotel during my recent 2 week stay in Madrid. Over the duration of 2 weeks my room was moved three times as a result of multiple issues at this property. My first several days at this hotel, ended with me in the accident and emergency department getting stitches. Due to a broken tile and missing threshold, my foot was lacerated bad enough to require stitches. On my way to the hospital I stopped by the front desk and advised them what had happened. Four hours later when I returned to the hotel after being treated in the ED, I found the room exactly as I left it. The blood, the missing wood, nothing had been touched. I went back to the desk to complain and was told that the maintenance supervisor was on vacation, and the manager would call me the next day!!!! The next day, after not receiving a call from the manager, and now without air conditioning I had to return to the front desk to complain again. I was moved to another room that night. Never did anyone apologize for my injury or try to take responsibility. Once in the room, on my very first night, I had discovered bugs in the room. I called the front desk and they said they would sent the housekeeper to the room to spray pestisides. I advised that I was NOT going to breath pestisides and they ask me to tell them when I was leaving and they would spray the room. I was horrified at their response, and went to the desk in person. The very rude staff advised me that Madrid was a very old city, and sometimes the outside bugs come in. After being disrespected with very bad broke English, I returned to my room. The following day the manager, I believe his name was Michael called me in my room. He asked me "What do I need", as if I was somehow responsible for all of the issues within the hotel. Following our conversation, he again moved me to another. There was no apology, no offer of a free drink, or any attempt to make my horrific stay better. The third and final room I was moved to was AGAIN, without functioning AC. It was the worst work trip I can imagine. I agree with the earlier post, the staff was certainly not very nice if you dont speak Spanish. I have seen many positive post about this hotel, so I was excited to stay here. It is clear to me now that many of those post are clear fabrications! I see that the management frequently replies to visitors after they post comments on here, but take it from me firsthand they were not at all helpful in real time.

Reviews.Title: “full 4 stars if there was free wifi”
Reviews.Author: adit3005
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights, booked through lastminute for total of 193 pounds for 2 people. Nadia was great, excellent english and checked us in at noon. double sinks were great, fresh sheets and towels. range of pillows in the directory but only std one was available. was prompt when we called for a scissors. great room let down by poor interior designing as had lots of superflous furniture, tiny drawers that are no use to anyone and excessive lamps. tv worked fine and air condition was good. supply of body gels etc was also adequate. full fridge, no bathrobe and slippers in room. curtains felt thick with the dust of time. location 5mins from sol on the redline can walk to museums in 15mins. Nadia gave us a late checkout when we fell sick with dodgy tapas, they held our bags in a safe room till our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: owan2002
Reviews.Content: Ideal location close to all the places you want to go to. Staff friendly, Last review said unfriendly to Americans...I stayed the same days and were fine towards me. Recommend there airport transfer, cheaper than airport taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AlexisLISBOA
Reviews.Content: Great location. The room was small but clean. Good AC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: MorrisMPAus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vincci Centrum for two nights and were pleased with the room and hotel. Really central location. 3 minute walk to Sol and Gran Via. 1 minute walk to Metro (which is fantastic in Madrid). Room was good size, clean, good airconditioning, and quiet. We had a room that overlooked the street and would not have known (although it was a quiet street also). Free internet is only with a cord (ie not WiFi), however starbucks around the corner has 45 minutes free WiFi with any purchase (hotel wifi was very expensive). We had free carparking included however it was at a different Vincci hotel which was tricky to get to driving but really close to walk. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Madrid Mansion”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth t
Reviews.Content: The delicious breakfast was varied, and we always enjoyed the food. Also the great location was a great asset to our stay in Madrid because we could easily get everywhere for touring and World Youth Day. We stayed here for a week, and we're sad to leave the hotel in Madrid. Also, we appreciated the design elements, which included bright orange accents. There is no Wi-fi, but ask the front desk for a cable if you brought a laptop. The service was great. Shout-out to Raul, who always attended to our needs! You'll want to climb the 156 stair steps at every opportunity, so don't miss out. (There are also two elevators.)

Reviews.Title: “The service and location are unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: AHPaul
Reviews.Content: Vincci Centrum is ideally located a I minute walk from the Sevila metra station. The Metra of Madrid is also excellent. VC is also a 5 minute walk from the center of Madrid. The staff are extremely friendly and knowledgable, speaking both Spanish and English which helped our group from Chicago. Breakfast is great, with hot and cold choices and the rooms have all you need. The rooms have great ac as we experienced the hottest week of the year. Bathrooms are stylish and sleek in the euro ambience. Would come back in a heartbeat. Mucho grasias Vincci Centrum!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, friendly staff, very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Moonpiedream
Reviews.Content: The Vincci Centrum is a pleasant walk from the Prado, the Plaza del Sol, the Plaza Mayor and many of the tourist sites in central Madrid. The rooms are a little small, but very well done, and the staff was very courteous and helpful. We skipped the breakfast since it was very expensive, but there were many places to eat nearby, so this was not a problem. The hotel was an excellent value, and we would definitely recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellente quality-price , fantastic for business or tourism.”
Reviews.Author: JavierPerezJuan
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff, breakfast, comfortable beds and cleanliness. The staff always with a smile and earring(slope) of helping yourself at all time. I usually travel to Madrid for business and this hotel wil be my future choose.

Reviews.Title: “great value, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: maya048
Reviews.Content: the hotel is a great place to stay: fabulous location, good value but most importantly fantastic service, very friendly, always smiling and ready to help. highly recommended place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: AlbertHotel1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, and the staff was wonderful and welcoming. We loved the this boutique hotel and it`s own elegant style.Hotel is in very convenient location in close proximity to Puerta del Sol and Prado museum. Service was friendly and efficient. Hotel is tucked away in one of the side streets-so we had no noise problems.

Reviews.Title: “Location good....shame about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: jthat5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location. Double beds were only available in internal rooms which though nice had NO natural light. The windows overlooked a stairwell. This made the room very dark and really made a difference in the morning. For this reason we thought it was overpriced. Staff weren't particularily helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Good location, great breakfast, but noisy room with poor airconditioning.”
Reviews.Author: Erasmuspilot
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 night on a business trip. The hotel is very nice indeed and looked very clean with beautiful design and very clean rooms. Very often in Spanish hotels breakfast is a disappointment. Not so in the Vincci centrum hotel: The breakfast was great with a vast choice of bread, fruits, meats, cereals etc.... If you bring your own laptop, you can enjoy free high-speed cabled internet in your room. Wifi is not free! Location is good. Only 10 minutes walking to the Plaza Mayor or the Prado for instance. Also the staff was very professional, helpful and friendly. BUT...Make sure you ask for a quiet room if you want a good night sleep. I was given a room on the first floor, street-side. Traffic outside is dense and noisy and the room was not well noise-insulated. Traffic will keep you awake or make you wake up early! Also the airco in my room was not (yet?) working. The weather was nice and sunny with outside temperatures rising to 25C in the shade in early april. When I got in bed, I estimate the temperature in my room was around 26C. I want 21C or less for a good night's sleep. The in room airco controller was set to cooling and full cold at high fan speed, but didn't blow cooled air. Either the airco was broke or the hotel hadn't switched on the central airco system yet. Frankly I expect airco to be available year round in (Spanish) hotels in this price class. Conclusion: good hotel, good staff, great rooms but still I would not recommend it due to poor sleep quality. (Noise and airco not working early april)

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a quiet room!”
Reviews.Author: Ace624
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times with no problems. It has a great location, very close to the Seville metro and just a few minutes walk from Puerta del Sol. That being said, make sure to ask for a quiet room away from the street. The hotel is located on a side street but there was still quite a bit of traffic and random street noise. After a couple of nights in a room on the 3rd floor facing the street I switched to a higher floor with an interior view....of the fire escape! It was much quieter and the room was actually a lot bigger too. The bathrooms are nice and the desk staff was also helpful. Other than the street noise, the hard bed, and the price it is a good place to stay. It seemed to me that the prices were significantly higher than the last time I was there. I would probably check out another place desk time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a wonderfull terace”
Reviews.Author: roraBelgique
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, next to Opera metro station, within the walking distance of 5 min till Sol. The street is usy, but not principal, so not very very noisy. Its a boutique hotel, small and cosy, very modern desigh (for example, in the bathroom - evier of Villeroy and Bosch..), also they give you plenty of bathroom creams, gels and shampoos. In our room we had as well the peignoirs and pantoufles..Actually all depends on the room you get. In the beginning they gave us a horrible room facing the inside patio, all dark and smelling strange deodorant, there you fell like in a cave, its not acceptable. But then we asked for changing the room, and got the fantastic room in 7th floor (number 705), facing the street with enormous terrace..Gorgeous. You could see all Madrid from there. And it is so high, that you dont hear any noise there. That was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel, good value & location”
Reviews.Author: asdaq
Reviews.Content: Vincci Centrum is a nice boutique hotel centrally located in Madrid. It is about a 5-7min walk to Puerta del Sol (which i believe was one of the closer subway stations). The rooms were a good size with modern look and nice bathrooms. I was very satisfied with the price but if you can find something closer to sightseeing venues then you should probably book it. We did not have breakfast in our rate so cannot comment on it.

Reviews.Title: “Awwwesome”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust1979
Reviews.Content: Great/prime location, great staff, great rooms, great price (thanks to tripadvisor.com). Everything was perfect, metro was down the street, puerto del sol/prado/etc. was walking distance. Enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality hotel in excellent location with nice room service”
Reviews.Author: FcatAndScat
Reviews.Content: We spent four days in the Vincci Centrum hotel and we enjoyed every minute of it. The hotel was right in the heart of Madrid, just a few steps away from all the bars and museums. Also, we really liked the Vincci Hamburgers they make. Really recommend those. The staff was pleasant especially on our departure. We had an early flight to catch and they arranged for a shuttle car to the airport and gave us coffee and juice on the house at 4:00 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location but horrible service.”
Reviews.Author: Gunnar Már Á
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minutes and got a great price. We were extremly satisfied with the location of the hotel. But the staff were so snooty! A little smile would be nice to see after a long flight. They just wanted to get us out of the reception and up to our room and were not really interested in our needs or questions. So we go up to the room #407 and we look in and see a very "cozy" room. Meaning its a bit small but the bathroom was wonderful with a bathtub and variety of amenities. But there was no view out the window. It was a bit claustrophobic. Our only view was to a stairway that I think was the fire exit/smokers getaway. However all facilities were very nice and it looked great. And again the location was priceless and worth the bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel in the middle of all the action Madrid can offer”
Reviews.Author: trbr78
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is it's very close to everywhere within 5-10 min.s walking distance but it is in a quiet street. The hotel decor is contemporary and relaxing. Having said that the room we stayed in was on the smaller side for a twin bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but probably on par with others in its class/category”
Reviews.Author: itzmyyear
Reviews.Content: The general look/feel of the interior of this hotel is contemporary/trendy. The location is good, close to the Metro and within walking distance of many of the must-see plazas, museums, monuments, etc. The free internet access is a bonus! The two main complaints, which put this hotel in the "I'd probably try another hotel if I were in the area again" category are: the mattress was ridiculously hard/uncomfortable and the shower got no more than lukewarm and the water pressure was dismal during my 3-day stay. I showered at various times of day/night, hoping for better results during an "off-time", to no avail. I gave up the option of a bath completely. I consider the rate paid for this hotel to be on par with many others in the area that offered similar amenities, and in lieu of similar reviews re: beds/showers, would probably opt for another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Dark and Dreary..... Both the Hotel and the Service”
Reviews.Author: bobyankee
Reviews.Content: The room we were given (510) had a small window facing another wall of the hotel. Since it let in no light, we felt like we were living in a shoe box. To make matters worse, the room was done in dark brown tones, with a faux dark brown vinyl floor. The hot water did not work and neither did the AC. Maintenance came up and said to just run the water for 10 minutes and it would get hot. He also fixed the AC so that it got the room to an OK temperature. We asked if we could change our room but were told no. The elevator is so small that my wife and I had to go to our room separately. No bell service was available. We asked the front desk to call us a cab and were told to go to the street to hail one ourselves. We paid around $170 a night and breakfast was not included. Cost of hotel breakfast was 17 Euros ($26) a person. Needless to say, we went to the Starbucks around the corner. This hotel is not horrible, but their are so many better choices in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel, Great Location, Very Nice/Helpful Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: TRinSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 8/23 for three nights. Got in early on a red eye from US. Rooms were not ready due to our early arrival and the hotel being solidly booked. Miriyea (sp?) who was working the front desk was very helpful; had us store our luggage, recommended a nice coffee place around the corner and had the rooms ready for us with an hour. Beds are hard but still comfortable, our room faced the street and had plenty of light and was quiet. Room size reminded me of a SpringHill Suites by Marriot w/o the sitting area and a much bigger bathroom than SHS. The location was fantastic!!! Walking distance to majority of tourist sights. We had only three days in Madrid. With that short period, we used the Tourist Bus one day which have stops (both red and blue lines) about a block from the hotel. Don't miss Plaza Santa Ana for a late night cerveza of coffee and if you are in Madri on sunday, a walk through Retiro Park. We went to the big three museums. By far the Del Prado, in my very inexperienced opinion, was the best but all we excellent. We also tried to do too much in three days.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location; Nice Room - with Hard Beds and no sunlight”
Reviews.Author: iheartmadrid
Reviews.Content: We decided on the Vincci Centrum over the other Vincci's because it was cheaper. Overall we liked the hotel. We had to switch rooms as our first non-smoking room smelled of stale cigarette smoke. The second room had no odor. Unforturnately we didn't read the reviews on Trip Advisor that said to get a room with a street view. Our room faced the alley - or shaft of the building. It was a giant echo chamber. The windows opened - but there wasn't any air circulation. We were on the 5th floor - and couldn't see above the walls to see what the sky looked like. There were alot of lighting options in the room - but we did miss the natural light in the morning. Thankfully there was so much to do in Madrid - that when we got back to the room at 5:30 AM....I guess maybe it was better if we didn't have direct sunlight in the room. The staff was helpful to us and understood our requests because my travel friend is fluent in Spanish. We didn't have the breakfast - but it looked very nice - a huge elegant buffet. If you just want a place to sleep - the place is fine. Unless you have a problem with hard bed. The beds were the stiffest mattress that I've ever slept on. They did offer different pillow options...but it didn't help the bed (that felt like a wooden board).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Marcelinha
Reviews.Content: The Vincci Centrum was a surprise for me, because it was so near to all the main atractions in Madrid. Thyssen, Prado and Reina Sofia Museus are within walking distance, as well as Atocha Station, Parque Del Retiro, Plaza de las Cibeles, shopping area... The tourist bus (the red ones, that cover the whole city) stop is just three blocks away and you can go walking also to the Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol, where are the biggest shops like El Corte Ingles, Zara and HM. Tha room was nice, well furnished, a big bathroom with a good shower, two sinks and good amenities. We didn´t have breakfast there, but we always went to a bar is the other corner (in front of the metro station) that had great berakfast. The staff was very nice to us, always helpfull, except for a girl (I suppose she is a girl... perhaps she´s a bulldog) named Mireia, who not only laugh at me when I asked for directions to go to a nice shop (as if it was impossible that someone like me could ever want to go to gucci) bus was also very rude when I asked a few other things and gave me wrong directions. I felt very mistreated by her. But besides her, the other ones were very nice, I have no complaints at all about the hotel. After that me and my family stayed in another Vincci, in Sevilla, where we were even more well treated. I would definitly recommed both hotels and would stay again in the Vincci chain hotels. Just be aware that Mireia might bite you... Im Madri, a very good tip is to go to the Reina Sofia in sundays mornings, it´s free (you save 9 euros per person!) and there´s not much people! After there, you can walking to the Parque del Retiro (with a stop in Atocha, that´s very beautiful) and have a nice day in the very beautiful park. Another tip os to eat at the recently renewed Mercado de San Miguel, near the Plaza Mayor. It was remodeled a few months ago and has lots of very nice shops and places to have tapas. The oysters and the cod tapas are just amazing. Near there, you can find Botin, the oldest restaurant in the world (they serve a spectacular lechón) and a street full of bars, where the Txacolina tapas place is great. We also went to a very hip bar/restaurant named Ramses, it´s a must go, very modern and chic.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ADSL1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the Vincci Centrum. We were in doubt which "Vincci" hotel to take, but it turned out that all 3 of 4 are so close to eachother that it really doesn't matter which one to take. I believe this is the cheapest one and this one has everything you'd want as a traveller. The room was fine. It has sort of design furniture and is clean. The bathroom was fine too. We asked for a room with windows (as other travellers recommended). That was a good tip, however, only if you don't mind having two seperate beds. Because all rooms on the outside of the hotel have 2 beds (next to eachother) instead of one KindSize bed. Another point is, that the street is quiet, but early each morning some trucks arrive to deliver something (I didn't look out of the window) and they leave the motor on quite long. Furthermore, the location was great. We walked everything in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Worth about $150/Night | Great Location | Decent Hotel | Below average service.”
Reviews.Author: vkbrentford
Reviews.Content: Went wiht my gf 1- Location - Just about perfect. Walking distance to everything from restaurants, bars, lounges to Museums. The hotel itself is quiet, not much traffic noise. Getting cabs is not an issue. 2- Rooms - Rooms were above average. Modern with all the necessaites - Bar, LCD TV (16 inch), fridge etc however, some of the room are NOT Street facing. So the inroom window give you a view of the shaft with no natural lighting. Make sure you get a street facing room. The flooring was laminated wood which is nice. Bathrooms were spacious and good. 3- Service - Bulk of the staff was ok, but there are a few who have a major attitude problem. Overall the service was below average. 4- Value for money - If you get a street faving room for aroun $150 / night - Grab it as everything else will cose you too much.

Reviews.Title: “Woundn't give it a 2 star rating”
Reviews.Author: shaz64
Reviews.Content: Myself and boyfriend Spent 1 night in this hotel due to the fact i had originally booked Vincci Via 66 but they had no water in the hotel so i had to move to one of their sister hotels and was told it was more money and better standard but was not charged any extra! well i think i should have been paid money to stay there, what a dump!!! room was tiny could hardly move around the bed and i'm very small, the room was was so dark and dingy and view of a brick wall. The room had dirty marks all over the walls and in all the hotel areas i saw it was the same, the corridoors and lifts were dirty and in good need of a good clean and paint. And for £100 a night i wouldn't call it a good deal. It spoilt my 1st visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we were expecting!!”
Reviews.Author: DubtravellerDublin
Reviews.Content: 31 August - 3 September 2008. Overall very poor. Went up to our double room and found that we had the view of a wall and fire escape - no natural light. We were then changed to a twim room as the hotel said they did not have any more doubles eventhough we had booked one - no apology either. The room and bathroom were very cramped with very little space for our stuff and we didn't have much! I had to have our key card re-charged twice per day Internet service too expensive and inflexible. Breakfast not included and too expensive - we ate out for breakfast which was cheaper and almost the same as the hotel menu.

Reviews.Title: “A good Madrid choice for the price”
Reviews.Author: grahamchapman
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Madrid twice, both times booked through travelocity. This hotel was the better deal. Plus points - the location is good for the museums and basically for anything. The hotel is smart and the rooms clean and modern - very good for the (discounted) price. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. Minus points - the air conditioning is feeble. Weak, old fashioned, doesn't do a great job. The street itself is a bit rundown - buildings being pulled down. However, I would recommend this to anyone browsing discounted madrid city hotels. I was pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4 days at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dms0001
Reviews.Content: Wife and i stayed here four days whilst enjoying Madrid. Enjoyed the Hotel, although did not have breakfast or use any of the amenities. Hotel is modern and well kept, staff helpful and not intrusive. Also very close to everything you want to see and do in Madrid. We had double with twin beds which was a reasonable size and very clean, tidy. comfortable beds, did not notice noise from outside, although we overlooked the street, apart from the odd building works going on across the street.. We may stay again when visiting madrid

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient”
Reviews.Author: TravellerBeth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is sufficient. Nice, clean, modern rooms, adequate in size. Refrigerator. Free internet (cable 10Euro deposit, will get back). Breakfast is not incuded (16Euro). The only window leads to an ugly internal stairwell, but there is at least a/c. The location is good and within walking distance of Retiro, Museo del Prado and Plaza Mayor (a longer walk to the Royal Palace.). Our email receipt mentioned that we had to pay at booking, but our credit card was never charged (and emails went unanswered). No problem because we just paid upon check-in, and they did honor the 6% advanced booking discount.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, modern decoration, would have been nicer if room had any view”
Reviews.Author: iabbes
Reviews.Content: It is centrally located, near Prado and Thyssen Museums, walking distance to almost everywhere in the historic part of Madrid. The street is not very nice, some abandoned builidings, but no issue, many streets in that area are. The hotel decoration is very nice and new, size of the rooms is good, staff is ok, but we were given a room with a window facing internal stairs, so no sunlight or privacy - it had to be closed all the time. Sound proofing is also not very good, specially when people were using the stairs... and breakfast is really expensive! It would have been a great experience if we had a window facing the street, make sure you ask fo it if you book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central Centrum”
Reviews.Author: EUROZONERDublin
Reviews.Content: I Stayed here with my partner for 6 days in Nov 07. The very good points re this hotel: -On a side street but close to Gran Via,Chueca,Museums,Retiro Park etc etc etc. Everywhere in city is within walking distance of this hotel so it's a very good central base. -The rooms are of a good size with plenty of wardrobe space. -Very good selection of food for buffet breakfast,Cheeses,Hams,Fruits,Juices,Tea,Coffee etc. The only slight negatives re hotel were the bathroom colour scheme is very dark so tough when shaving and there was a little delay when checking in as reception area not the biggest in this boutique style hotel. Overall,this is a v good 4 star hotel which is perfect for business travellers and tourists in an excellent location so i would stay here again on one of my future Madrid Trips.

Reviews.Title: “Look Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Beyond_the_Blue
Reviews.Content: Was in Madrid for one day of business and three days of r&r. I let my co-worker book this as he raved about it from his stay in '07. The Bad: No iron/ironing board available must use their express press service for $$$ and wait 24 hours. Room Service does not begin until 7 AM, closes in the afternoon for 3 or 4 hours as well. Que?? Unbelievable for a four star hotel. To add insult to injury there is no coffee/tea pot in the room. No hotel bar. Very non-descript restaurant that would only appeal to the most tired of guests. The lounge was most lame too, just a few sofa's with newspapers available. No option for drinks of any kind. Spent less than 10 minutes in total there, sans a long business lunch. The Good: Central location, friendly and accommodating staff. Rooms were OK, comfortable beds but not much space overall. I'd highly recommend you consider staying at the Hotel De Las Letras. Located a few blocks away and has better/more spacious rooms, full cocktail bar/lounge, full restaurant (street side with views and a pool, sauna & a Jacuzzi. Not to mention a great staff. I stayed there in '07 and will only look to book there for any and all Madrid trips.

Reviews.Title: “No room at the inn!!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlkk
Reviews.Content: I booked and paid for the Vincci Centrum Madrid via hotels.com three months prior to our arrival in Madrid. I rang hotel 24 hours prior to arrival to confirm we would arrive at 9.00pm the following evening. When we arrived we were told there was a heating problem with one of our rooms and it would not be possible to stay there. We were told there were two rooms available for us in their sister hotel the Vincci Soho. I asked that a taxi be called and was told it was too close. We were dispatched on foot accompanied by the hotel porter to show us the way. It was approx a five - ten minute walk on a cold night with our suitcases in tow. Reading some of the previous comments on Trip Advisor I see that we were not the only ones to have experienced the same problem and therefore in my opinion i believe the hotel over booked and as we were one of the last to check in we were bumped off to the Vincci Soho. I wouldnt book a room in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Could perhaps have been better?”
Reviews.Author: SuzyLeamingtonSpa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vincci Centrum for 2 nights as part of a birthday celebration trip to Madrid. On the positive side, the hotel was ideally located, central but in a quiet side street, and very handy for all the sights. Our initial check-in was efficient, if cold, but on arrival at our 8th floor non-smoking room we were dismayed to find that the room looked out onto an internal fire escape, and there was no natural light. As the furnishing and walls are very dark, the overall effect was very claustrophobic, so we decided to request another room. At this point, the service from the desk was most hostile and unhelpful - although we were very polite, asking if they had a room which had an external view, we were made to feel most uncomfortable. We were advised that we could only have a daylight view room if we would take a 'smoking' room, and we were rudely advised that we had asked for a 'no-smoking' room, 'so which did we want?' (we didn't realise that the two were mutually exclusive!). We said that we would have a 'smoking' room and were duly given a room at the front, which was fine. Unfortunately our unwelcoming 'welcome' was not improved during this procedure by one most unpleasant staff member tutting, and lapsing into rapid Spanish, with sidelong glances and smirks to his colleagues. We were never greeted as we entered and left the hotel from then on, although at check out a different member of staff was most pleasant and helpful, as were all the restaurant and cleaning staff. On the plus side, our request for extra pillows was immediately attended to, the hotel was clean and perfectly located. Although recently renovated, it is however starting to look a little tired round the edges, the lighting in the bathroom was hopeless for doing make-up, there was no full length mirror and there was a surprising lack of toiletries usually found in such hotels (eg. hair conditioner/cotton wool and the slippers that were promised in the brochure!). We did not request any of these items (reception desk manager too scary!) but felt that a bit more attention to detail would involve minimal cost, but provide an overall more satisfactory experience. Oh yes, and a customer relations course for the offending staff member would probably be of huge benefit to future visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, Clean, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gingernatorgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights in August 06 - really lovely hotel. Smart, modern and clean. Staff were very efficient - organised 2 tickets for us to watch Real Madrid on the same day which got delivered to the hotel. Fantastic tickets - not far from the pitch, great views of Beckham! Location of the hotel was really good - pretty much 5mins walk to all the shops of central madrid in one direction and the parks, prado etc in the other direction. Plus, just next to the Sol underground station which we used to travel from the airport.... Really good value for a central Madrid hotel. Would definitely go back here. Didn't eat or take breakfast - just across the main road was a nice coffee place where we had tomatoes on toast & a lovely coffee....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: The_Truffles
Reviews.Content: Despite the almost incessant rain that poured down throughout our first visit to Madrid, we had a thoroughly pleasent holiday due no doubt in part to our stay at the Vincci Centrum. This great little hotel is in a quiet side road, very close to the centre of Madrid and all it has to offer. The modern interior is welcoming, as are the staff, and the well appointed rooms have all you'd expect from a (relatively) recently refurbished hotel. Extra provisions within the hotel are fairly limited, but the staff are more than happy to serve drinks downstairs if you ask and we never struggled for access to the computer in the lobby when we needed it. This lack of extras is no doubt reflected in the price, which for us at least was entirely reasonable. The central location, coupled with the good price, means we'd almost certainly stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view?”
Reviews.Author: SaintLeTiss
Reviews.Content: At first sight and all the reviews etc, this hotel looked like a great place to stay. As well as being central it was within a resonable budget. The rooms were great, well decorated with a clean modern feel. Only problem being the air conditioning broke, we were promised it would be fixed every day but nothing happened. And when we got to the room it turned out that our room faced a fire escape exit. After no mentioning of this at time of booking etc i went down to try and switch rooms only to be told that all the rooms had this view. An obvious lie but at 3am i couldn't be bothered to argue. This realy would be an amazing hotel and one that i would eagerly recomenned if it wasn't for the fact you felt like you were in a black hole of time every time you were in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: cabowong
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located in Madrid, only minutes from Puerta del Sol and other tourist attractions. Also, Starbucks is around the corner from the hotel, for those morning fixes. We paid approximately EURO125 per night. Staff are okay and could be friendlier, but overall professional. The rooms were spacious and clean. Breakfast buffet is expensive considering what you get. I recommend going to a restaurant nearby instead of dining at the hotel. Overall, location, value, and cleanliness were key factors to our satisfaction. It should be noted that we stayed at the NH Abascal our first week in Madrid and wished that we stayed at the Vincci Centrum originally. Please see our reviews of the NH Abascal and the SPA Porta Maris (Alicante).

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnHertfordshireUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vincci Centrum Hotel for five days (four nights) in August. I can honestly say that I could not find fault with the hotel except that for two people in one room there wasn't enough wardrobe space and we lived partially out of the suitcase. Apart from that, the room size, although on the small side was more than adequate and very modern. Everything was spotlessly clean and well maintained throughout. It had a nice bathroom with a bath/shower, bidet and his 'n' hers basins. Our room was at the front of the hotel and we did not suffer any road noise at all as the rooms are double glazed. Bearing in mind we had the sun shining into our room during the best part of the day and the temperature outside was 38 degrees on occasions, the air conditioning worked fine and on maximum chill setting (ie flat out!) it kept the room comfortable but not freezing cold. The reception staff spoke good English and were very helpful and accomodating but did not appear to be that friendly. We paid slightly less than £50 per room per night (expedia.co.uk) on a room only basis, the breakfast was an extra 15 euro per person per day (payable locally) and at 30 euros per couple, I thought this was expensive for what looked like a very ordinary but adequate buffet breakfast. We chose to have breakfast at local restaurants which we found to be good and inexpensive. Finally, as per previous reviews, I can cofirm that this hotel is perfectly situated, centrally located and surprising close to all the major attractions, museums, plazas, shops etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Vincci Centrum”
Reviews.Author: mad-mat-nz
Reviews.Content: After reading some mixed reviews on various websites, I was a little apprehensive, but my fears were quickly dismissed once we arrived. Ideally located on Cedarceros, about 7-10min stroll from Puerta del Sol, and about 1 min from the Sevilla metro station, Vincci Centrum was a modern, plush hotel with all usual amenities. Even a pillow menu! (I ordered a Medium, it was nice). Some people have said the AC in their rooms didn't work, but ours was fine. King size bed, his & hers basins & in room safe. Would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “No Air Conditioning!”
Reviews.Author: Ian C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vincci Centrum for two separate 2-nite stays in July while on vacation. While the showers are great (as noted in other reviews) and the decor is chic, the hotel does not have adequate A/C in the rooms to make a trip to Madrid manageable in the summer. For travelers staying during other times of the year, this might not be a problem, but if you're stay is anytime between June and August, spend your money elsewhere so you can sleep at night! Details: After entering both rooms, I turned the AC up to full, but only a slow breeze of slightly cool air came out. In both rooms on the two separate occasions, both my wife and I woke up in the middle of the night sweating. I speak fluent Spanish and spoke with the reception after the first night, requesting that the AC in my room be fixed or I be given another room. They first said that there wasn't anything they could do, then said they would have the mechanic come by. That evening the mechanic still hadn't come by and they said they'd try to find another room for the second 2-nite stay later that week. While they did find another room, the AC was exactly the same and we had much difficulty sleeping. There are plenty of other hotels in Madrid in this price range--my advice to summer travelers would be to pass on the sleek furnishings and stay somewhere more mundane that has at least invested in a decent air conditioning system. Laptop Tip: If you are bringing a laptop, make sure to have your own internet cord. There are internet ports in the room (but no cords) and while they will let you borrow a cord at reception for a 10 euro deposit, they were all taken when I asked for one. They charge for wireless access (only available downstairs in the lobby).

Reviews.Title: “Nice but falls short”
Reviews.Author: paulieuk
Reviews.Content: I won't go in to great detail on things that others have already written - it is a great location, the exterior room I had was nicely decorated, bright and quiet (and not huge but not tiny either). However, be warned that there are no irons in the room and they will not bring one to you either - they will instead offer you the laundry/pressing service. Not good if you realise something needs ironing an hour before you're going out in it! Also, the wifi internet is not free, nor is it reasonably priced. The wired internet in the rooms is free, but cables are not provided and although the front desk lend them out (EUR10 deposit) they clearly don't have more than a handful and I only got one 30 minutes before checking out! The room safe had been screwed down above the vent from the minibar refridgerator below and so the contents were being slowly heated! It was large enough, just, to take my 13" macbook, but only without its cover on. As I keep finding with bathrooms that have designer washbasins, the plug mechanism was faulty and so the water constantly drained out of the basin... and the spotlight lighting in the bathroom made shaving more difficult. And unusually for a '4-star' hotel, only two large towels were provided. So I would stay here again, but not before trying out some other hotels in the same bracket.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & But Mixed Fellings”
Reviews.Author: PapaEdwin
Reviews.Content: We arrive and had no problems at check in, it was fast and easy. Working at check-in was Sara a spanish woman that was very helpfull and told us the way around. We got room 203 facing the street and when we came back at night the air conditioning was not working so we had to complain two times before they gave us another room. Then we got room 106 facing the street too. Try to avoid the rooms facing the street as they are very noisy at night. Rooms are very small but very clean. The bathrooms are beautifuly decorated with two sinks and a nice set of complements. The tub is standard size and you have to be carefull when taking a bath as they will drip a lot of water to the floor(bad design). Vincci Hotels defintly are saving on soap as we got only one very small glicerine soap per day, so you take one bath and it's gone. Even when you ask for more soap they are hesitant to give it to you so advice "Bring your own soap". The rooms have Broadband Internet either Wi-Fi or ethernet. Wi-fi signal was a little poor so bring your ethernet cable as they wil charge you 1.50 euro per day to rent you one. The rooms have safe box, mini bar and a very small closet. I belive there were only 6 hangers in the closet of room 203 but double closet space on room 106 so try getting a corner room. The safe didnt work and even after they offer to fix it it never happened. Anyway nothing was missing after our 4 day stay and I felt very secure leaving me things unsecure in the room. The lobby is small but beautiffuly decorated and have Wi-Fi Internet Access. We didnt had any food or drinks in the hotel so I can't comment on food and beberage. I can recomend this hotel but you should read others reviews before you make up your mind. I beleive that if Vincci had invested a little more on maintenance in this hotel I would have been able to give it a better review.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Poor service...”
Reviews.Author: oldtownalex
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation for the Vincci Soho. Travel weary and jet-lagged, we arrived at the doorstep ready to get some much needed rest. The desk reported to us there was a "problem with our room" and that we would need to check into the Vincci Centrum (we suspect the "problem" was overbooking). We were asked to move 3 blocks away to a sister location, the Vincci Centrum, without so much as an apology. We were booked into the Vincci Centrum, into a smoking room, although we had reserved a non-smoking room with Vincci Soho. The next problem encountered was the lack of internet connectivity within our room. This was one of the selling points for the Vincci Soho as we both needed to do some work remotely while in Spain. The front desk seemed un-sympathetic with the situation. They grudgingly offered to let us log into the internet in another room they were saving in case a late night traveler arrived at their door step - it wasn't reserved. We told them that was inadequate - and had to demand they either fix our internet or give us a room with it. They grudgingly moved us into the room they were saving. The rooms are extremely cramped. The view was of a brick wall from our room, so make sure to be explicit in your reservations if a view is important for you. The rooms were very nicely appointed - looks like they were recently updated. However, there is an odd 1/3 shower door arrangement that makes it impossible to shower without getting water all over the bathroom. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel - mainly based on the poor service. My experience with hotels in this price range is if there is a problem, it is solved immediately with apologies, or the hotel does what they can to make up for the inconveniences through other complimentary services. We felt we had to cajole them into providing the basic services described on their website, which isn't much fun. We stayed at another Vincci hotel (Vincci La Rabida) in Seville. The lobby and dinning facilities were beautiful, however the service lacked here as well. We reviewed it as well. I recommend trying a hotel outside of the Vincci chain, or else anticipating the minimum service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Shopswat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, easy walking distance to the main areas but also near to a metro station. The hotel has a stylish and modern decor however it does feel quite dark. Our room was clean and well decorated but did not have any natural light as the window faced an internal courtyard but this also meant that the room was quiet. In the evening the Chueca area has cool restaurants, or you can wander round the old streets of Plaza Mayor. Don't eat dinner before 10pm as you will miss out on the buzz of the city - the streets were still full at 3am! A good 3am bar for flamenco music (and very close to the hotel) is Cardamomo on Calle Echegaray. The location makes this hotel one to recommend particuarly if you get a good deal on the web!

Reviews.Title: “Clueless front desk and postage stamp sized room”
Reviews.Author: rm94114
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location, very convenient for everything in Madrid, but the service is completely absent. The front desk personnel seem to be constantly confused about everything from how to operate the computer to where to find things. It took 4 phone calls and a visit to the front desk to get extra pillows. The phone will not work for external calls and the room is tiny, but attractive in design, just claustrophobic with only a view of a concrete wall out the tiny window. Breakfast buffet was acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Boutique Vincci Centrum”
Reviews.Author: Fourth_Musketeer
Reviews.Content: We recently visited a few cities in Spain, with Madrid being our last stop. We stayed at the Vincci Centrum which is situated in the middle of the downtown area, just 10 minutes walk to Puerto del Sol to the West and 10 minutes walk to the Fountains of Cibeles and Museo Prado to the East. The metro closest to the hotel is Sevilla which is about half a block and around a corner from it on calle Cedaceros. Everything is within walking distance, if you like to walk. If not, the metro is very convenient. The monuments, museums, palaces, plazas and shopping are within 20 minutes walk in any direction, but planning is necessary in order to avoid retracing your steps and wearing out your feet and shoes. The hotel itself is quite small, hence the boutique feel and look. The look and feel of the place is comfortable with modern furnishings and dark woods to give it a clubby kind of mood. The look and feel continues into the rest of the hotel and into the rooms. There were no single king or queen sized beds available in non-smoking rooms, so we had to settle for 2 twins, which was fine since they could be pushed together anyway. The room is small, with dark wood floors and furnishings, but enough space to relax. There's lots of lighting to brighten up the darkness. The bathroom is very modern with fully loaded features such as two sinks, bidet, toilet, and bath/shower with a very large shower head for full soaking. There's also a hairdryer and complimentary bath products. It was located on the seventh floor, with a window facing the inside stairwell atrium which made it very very quiet. The pictures you see of the hotel on the internet is exactly what you get, therefore if you like the look on the internet, you'll like this hotel. We didn't eat at the hotel, even though there was supposed to be a complimentary breakfast included. We had too much to see and do in too short a time frame to stop. Though we did enjoy meals around town, which were always very good. All in all, this hotel was very nice: restful to the body, attractive to the eyes and peaceful to the mind.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: VirgilG
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights in may 2007. The location of the hotel is perfect: a short walk from everything but in a quiet street (which is not the case for the other Vincci hotels in Madrid Soho and Capitol). We were in a room facing the street in the second floor, it was quiet and well isolated from the other rooms and from the street, we had no problem with the noise during our stay. Our room was quite small but clean and well decorated in a modern style with comfortable beds and pillows (you have a "pillow menu" and you can choose one) . We only had a (bad) breakfast once in the hotel and then we followed an advice we found in another trip advisor review and went to "Faborit" just a minute walk from the hotel: the croissants and the coffee were far better there! I would certainly come back in Vincci centrum. This hotel is a good choice if you want to spend a few days walking in the noisiest city in Europe and sleep at night!

Reviews.Title: “Good option”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Traveller47
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed ath the Vincci Centrum over a UK Bank Holiday weekend in May. The hotel is very well located being within easy walking distance of just about everything yet the street it is on is relatively quiet. We are used to having a room with a window, if not with a view then at least with access to some natural light ,so it was a bit of a shock to the system to have a dark room that looked out onto an internal stairwell. We were given the option of upgrading to a superior room for 40 euros per night extra. However, though this room had a balcony, the room itself was smaller with twin beds rather than a king and we didn't feel that the price was worth it considering we planned to be out of the hotel most of the time. Though dark, ours was a comfortable, decently decorated and clean room that served our purposes fine. We did feel that the bathroom was not very well designed - the taps in the basins are really badly positioned and getting to the tap in the shower/bath was a pain. Decent range of free goodies though and nice to have 'his and hers' basins!

Reviews.Title: “Walking Distance to Everything!”
Reviews.Author: rb14113
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vincci Madrid Centrum in Madrid for a few days the first week of April. The hotel is perfectly located, walking distance to all the major attractions as well as right on the route for the Madrid Vision hop-on, hop off tour bus. I couldn't have asked for a better location. My only gripe would be that there wasn't a great tapas bar right in the area, although you certainly didn't have to walk far to get to one. I never ate at the hotel, but highly recommend the Faborit a block down the street for breakfast. Just walk right past the Starbucks and head for Faborit for espresso, a chocolate croissant, and fresh squeezed orange juice!! As a female traveller alone in Madrid for a few days, I was little nervous about hotel choices, but the Vincci Centrum is so well located that I never had any concerns. As for the hotel itself, the rooms are clean and very nicely appointed (although the half shower door apparently found throughout Spain is a very bad design); the staff answered questions when asked but was not overly friendly; it felt very much like a business hotel; everybody stays out of the way as much as possible. But the location can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: imabari
Reviews.Content: We booked a room on the hotel website and asked for a bright room facing the street as recommended by these reviews. We were given an internal room on the 2nd floor which was a little dark but very quiet. On our last night we asked to move and got a bright room on the 4th floor, not facing the street, which was quiet and perfect. The staff were very accommodating which was great. The difference was immense and we were very happy with the new room. Both rooms were well fitted out and very modern. the shower was awesome and the bed was very comfy. The location was perfect and only a block from the Sol and many of the local attractions and restaurants were within easy walking distance. The hotel is excellent for a city break and simple to get to on the Metro from the airport. We would stay here again when back in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: HantsBaggie-Bird
Reviews.Content: Agree with everyone that location is great! Although took advice of asking for room facing the street - big mistake! We were there Mon - Fri so maybe it's far noisier during the week but it was like sleeping in the middle of Picadilly Circus! Rush-hour started before 7am and still noisey at 02:30am. Hi-tech & stylish except bad design fault with bathroom sinks! Tap is fixed in position so unable to get face anywhere near! Didn't eat in hotel as plenty of choice around. Good restaurant for both breakfast & dinner is Madrid 1 Catedral (c/San Jeronimo). Take EU passport when visiting heritage sites on Wednesdays for free admission, especially Royal Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location - a few tips”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeLady
Reviews.Content: My family converged in Madrid for a week's holiday at Christmas. We all stayed at the Vincci Centrum and were very pleased with the hotel. The rooms are somewhat small, like all European hotels, but had some nice extras such as lighted closets, double sinks and full bathtub. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful both with room-related questions and with booking restaurant and theater reservations. The hotel's central location is fantastic - we rarely took the Metro since almost everything is within 15 minutes walk. When you reserve and check in, it is worth asking for a room that faces the street rather than the airshafts since there is little street noise, you'll get better light, and will be away from the elevators. There is a free in-room safe that was just large enough to hold our laptop computer. Access to the Wi-Fi network in the hotel and the lobby computer must be purchased (~5 euros for 30 minutes), however if you have your own laptop and an ethernet cord, there is free Internet access in the rooms. (The hotel has a few loaner cords, but I would bring your own.) There was enough space in the mini-bar fridge to hold a few snacks and small water bottles of our own. The hotel has an extensive breakfast buffet for 15 euros which we ate only on Christmas day. You can certainly eat your money's worth, but we preferred to save our appetites/calorie budget for lunch. We usually went to Hontares around the corner, a typical cafe with a vague Mexican association, which has a good value breakfast menu on weekdays. (Go left out of hotel, left on c Alcala and left again at c Sevilla ). There is also a Starbucks very nearby. Two nearby restaurants that we enjoyed very much: La Finca de Susana (c Arlaban) and Edelweiss, a German place on the corner of Zorrilla and Jovellanos that was surprisingly good (the duck in particular is excellent). Overall, a great experience!! We would definitely go back to the Vincci Centrum.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but..”
Reviews.Author: Sarah W
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked as it could accommodate quite a few of us (about 10) on a weekend break for a friend's birthday. The layout of the room was good, although the room looked out to tarpaulin. The bathroom was clean and the shower was fabulous, it also had twin sinks. The only downside was the provision of drinks and food. After experiencing an exceptional night in Madrid and getting up and site seeing the next day an afternoon break was needed and some sustenance. However, the bar and café area are closed until 5pm and then only drinks are available. This is the same for room service. I know there are plenty of places to eat in Madrid, but not next to the hotel and not without a walk. This was the only downside, if we had known we would have eaten before returning. The hotel is ideally placed for the nightlife (without being noisy) and shopping in and around puerto del sol.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your purse”
Reviews.Author: epcmNY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel two months ago and had no problems with it until I was eating breakfast on the last day. There was an odd-looking man pacing around the restaurant, talking on his mobile, switching seats. The waiters passed him multiple times but paid no attention to him. They didn't even ask to take his order. Then the man got up, walked behind another unsuspecting diner's chair, and slid her purse off the chair. I saw him do this and shouted. The waiters did absolutely nothing. I ended up outside confronting him and not a single hotel employee came to my aid, fortunately another diner did. The man ended up dropping the purse. But not one person who worked at that hotel called the police, questioned the woman on if the robber was able to take any of her belonging, or even apologized for allowing him to come into the restaurant. Having had an otherwise nice stay at this hotel, I was extremely disappointed about the caviller attitude the staff takes in regards to protecting their guests.

Reviews.Title: “dark room”
Reviews.Author: farouq
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 3 nights in the Vincci Centrum. Loacation-wise it's spot on, being a 5 minute stroll to Peurto del Sol and within walking distance of lots of other attractions. This hotel markets itself as 4-star...but it's not up there. Firstly the lobby area is tiny, everywhere in the hotel is so dark, lit constantly by harsh spotlights which just heat the place up. The reception staff have excellent english and are helpful to a degree (when i asked them to call a cab to the airport for me i was told to stand on street....nice!!). Also had problem with air-con and was told nobody could take a look at it till the following day. They also have very annoying habit of interrupting you mid-flow to answer the phone, leaving you just standing there waiting for them to return to you. We spent our first 2 nights in a room which had no natural light, a small window opened onto an internal fire escape which was always in darkness. The harsh spotlights made everything seem surreal in the middle of the day. Girlfriend went a bit stir crazy with the cabin fever. Again i'd agree with the rooms being too small and having too much furniture. Bathrooms are good though, great shower, 2 sinks, big mirror. Asked to be moved to exterior room after 1st night, but were told at 12.30 that we were too late. Eventually moved the next morning. New room was fine (no noise at all). If i hadn't had experience of 1st room i'd probably be agreeing with the hotel's 4 star rating but the interior rooms are a huge problem, avoid them. This hotel has no bar area just seating in the lobby. Overall no atmosphere. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Patriots4
Reviews.Content: Good central location and reasonable facilities for the price. Room was clean and well appointed. Staff were well-mannered and helpful. Didn't sample the breakfast - ate at the Nebraska diner round the corner - good food and inexpensive. The location of the hotel allowed us to reach most, if not all of the sites in greater-Madrid. It's not really far to walk, but pace yourself and make sure you screen yourself from the sun if you go at this time of year. Architecture is stunning and steeped in history - well worth taking your time over. I'd go back to Madrid like a shot, and would be happy with the Centrum again - no question.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: TheKatt
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel! Extremely modern and luxury rooms. Fantastic location, quiet ( request a room facing the inner stairs! not the street), extrememly clean and very nice staff. Booked it on Expedia, $89.00 a night, in the past have paid $300.00 to stay in a hotel this nice. Highly recommend it! Loved Madrid, great city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MSPTravelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 10 day trip to Spain and our vacation started out with two nights at the Vincci Centrum in Madrid. Upon arrival, the staff was curteous and held our bags as it was well before check in time. Once in the room, our first impression was that it was a little small. But, after all - how much time would we really be spending in the room? The hotel was VERY clean, the bathrooms were awesome (his and her sinks anywhere in Europe is a treat!!), the staff was helpful, the rooms were extremely quiet and the location could not have been better. The bellman did say that in one year, they would be doing construction on the building next door so that might be something to keep in mind. The one criticism was that we asked the front desk for a restaurant recommendation and the person helping us just rummaged and gave us a card for a restaurant over near Plaza Mayor. We took a stroll past the restaurant and it was closed on Sundays. Probably a very minor oversight on the hotel's part. If you're looking for a nice restaurant with a cool bar area and atmosphere, we would suggest DL's Restaurant (in the nearby De Las Letras Hotel - Gran Via, 11). Overall, our stay here was great and we would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: LRKTraveler
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel during our 3 night stay in Madrid. We arrived at the hotel prior to check in time, but the friendly English speaking staff gladly accepted our bags and told us what time to check into our room. The front desk staff and the bell staff were very courteous. The room was quite small, but well designed, making the space seem far larger than it was. The bathroom was also well designed and nice. The shower was unbelievable! The water pressure was the best I have ever experienced. The location was fantastic. One block from a subway stop and just a few minutes to the main Plaza. Although it was located on a side street, make sure you close your window at night or you will be disturbed by street noise. However, we couldn't have asked for more and for the price we paid, I believe we could not have done any better in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “V.nice Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Gabrielle99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August 2005, bit of a delay in writing review!!! Location: Good location, just around the corner from various plazas, 10 minutes walk from Puerto Del Sol. Hotel: receptionist friendly and helpful. Hotel can appear a bit dark inside due to decor, but v clean and modern. Room: Quite small room, and appears dingy at times due to decor. But spotless and enough space and storage for 2 people. Bathroom is stunning - perfect for girls geting ready to go out. Big mirrors and good lighting. Power shower, big bath and 2 bowl sinks. Bathroom door is frosted glass so limited privacy at times. Bed is big but firm. Air con worked a treat. Didnt spend much time in hotel room anyway - there's too much to see. Sight-seeing: Get tickets for the tour buses so you can hop-on and off whenever you like. You'll get to see al the attractions and find things you want to see inc various plazas, stadium etc. Madrid is wonderful, enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Just the ticket”
Reviews.Author: goingplaces2006
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there along with ten other women (hen night) and it was fantastic! For the price you pay i was so impressed.
