The decor was lovely, they keep it clean and the staff are very accomodating. The breakfast is pricey but then i didn't have to eat again until the evening! Highly recommended whatever your budget is! It's location by the Sevilla metro couldn't be better and walking distace from all the tourist spots including night life!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJMark9
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my Stag Do in Madrid. Hotel was in a great location for everything!!. Rooms were clean and looked the part & staff were very friendly and helpful. It you a fancy a bit of very cool nightclubbing be sure to check out The Room. Its only a couple of streets down from the hotel. Just remember though it doesnt start getting going until around 4.00am!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for a better location”
Reviews.Author: Zoe&Mike
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have asked for better location than Vincci Centrum for a break in Madrid. 2 min walk from Sevilla metro stop and very easy to find. Lovely quiet, shaded road but still only 5 mins away from centre and short walk to beautiful Retiro Park. Was glad we hadn't booked to stay right in the middle, eg on Gran Via or Puerto del Sol as much busier late at night. Would definitely recommend. Modern, cool hotel. Tiny gripe would be only one mirror, which was in bathroom and poor lighting for getting ready! Nostrum Pizza Nostrum Pasta just up the road is nice for evening meal, lovely staff and great food if you fancy Italian!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Content: My wife an I had a front, standard room on the 5th floor. Although the decor [brown and orange] is beginning to look a bit dated, this did not detract from a very enjoyable stay. The staff, particularly in the dining room were polite,friendly and very efficient. We booked the buffet breakfast as part of the deal and the choice was extensive and well presented.All areas of the hotel were very clean and the location could not be better-central but on a quiet side street. Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Vincci Centrum in Madrid for four nights. Great location near Puerta del Sol and the Gran Via but none of the noise and activity of the main streets. Room was not huge by American standards but very comfortable and clean. Did not buy breakfast there as it is expensive and there are a number of cafes right around the corner that are fine for a quick Spanish style breakfast. We had a room with no outside light so it was totally quiet but I can not imagine that any room would be that noisy. Service was more than adequate with the staff speaking good English and being very helpful. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Vincci Centrum”
Reviews.Author: PollyG
Reviews.Content: The open top tourist bus trip that we took proved that this hotel is in a great spot for exploring Madrid by foot, it's also close to the metro too. Our rooms were comfortable although a little hot - probably because the weather when we went in February was exceptionally warm, unfortunately the power went off on our first evening so we were unable to use the air con... or lights!! This was sorted and the rest of our stay at the hotel was good. We liked the decor, which is modern and minimalist, and we thought that the hotel represented good value for money. The staff were helpful but discreet and were happy to phone to make restaurant bookings for us at no charge. We's certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my aching back”
Reviews.Author: Bells-n-hankies
Reviews.Content: Well positioned in the city centre. And if black and orange decor, a surfeit of spotlights, bedrooms slightly bigger than the bed, beds which feel more like bedrock, and a total absence of sources of natural light are your thing you'll be right at home. If you do go here, try the Nebraska cafe around the corner for breakfast - it's a fraction of what the hotel will charge you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: JWGashead
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights at the Vincci Centrum earlier this month and thought it was brilliant value. It's in an ideal location - on a relatively quiet street within walking distance of many sights and only two minutes from the nearest station on the excellent metro. Spotlessly clean with smart, modern decor. Friendly, efficient staff. All the facilities we needed. The only niggle is that breakfast is expensive but that doesn't matter because there are so many other places nearby. Unlike an earlier reviewer, we liked the Finca de Susanna restaurant nearby and went back there a second night. Good menu, well cooked food and about GBP15 per head for three courses, wine and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel 2006”
Reviews.Author: katyoldfield
Reviews.Content: Stated two nights, Feb/March 2006. Had read all the reviews before leaving and want to thank everyone who wrote they were a great help, not only with places to eat but about what to expect in the hotel. Agree no mirrors in bedroom lots in bathroom, being there with my daughter there was nowhere to look at ourselves. Had a lovely meal at JAZZANOVA about 200 yards down from Hard Rock Paseo de lat Castellana 8 madrid 28046 Phone ---- i had pork/bbq sauce gorgous, Great wine Marques de Riscal white 2004 Rueda Herederos del. Done the tour of the Stadium was impressed, done the Vision Bus tours great value only complante is that once you get of the bus, you really have to remember which of the stands is what you need to get back on and they arnt to regular. Felt abit nervous around the Plaza Major. Loved the shops and lots of lovely people.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel located within 10 minutes walking distance from key landmarks”
Reviews.Author: sklo2004
Reviews.Content: Vincci Madrid Centrum is located 8 to 10 minutes walking distance from the Prado Museum, Puerta del Sol, and the Old Madrid dining and shopping district. The street that i5 sits on is undergoing significant renovation and construction (as of my visit in January 2006) so the hotel is somewhat difficult to find. Be prepared to show your driver a Yahoo! Maps or Mapquest print-out with cross streets clearly marked. The entrance is small, but the hotel itself is very nice. My husband and I thought the location was ideal since we were able to walk to shops, tapas, and tour bus pick-ups from the hotel fairly easily. Vincci Madrid Centrum has a modern, minimalist decor. The rooms are fairly large and very clean, bathroom is well-equipped, and service is impeccable. Each room has a couch, small coffee table, ottoman, big closets, and desk; overall comfortably furnished. Room service food quality is superb and reasonably priced...to my surprise. A couple minor negatives about the hotel. First, the TV does not offer any English programming. Second, the wooden floors tend to make a lot of noise when you walk around with your shoes. This is noteworthy because when your hotel room neighbors walk back into their room at 4am, it is likely that the sound of their heels and boots walking all around the room will keep you up. Lastly, the hotel room door has a 3/4 inch gap on the bottom, and everytime someone smokes from the elevator lobby, it will get through to your room. Just use an extra towel to block it. Overall though, I thought the hotel was great and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Vincci for our Wedding Anniversary. We mentioned this to staff and they could not do enough for us. We found this to be really unusual for a city hotel, usually hotels on city breaks barely book you in and you feel they are waiting to ship you out. This was a very pleasant surprise. Nice surroundings, modern dark finishes but with soft warm colours. Friendly staff, they helped us to book tickets to the shows and bus trips, nothing was too much trouble. An ideal location for a short stroll to Puerto del Sol and some nice quaint cafes and restaurants along the way. Overall a great introduction to Madrid, we will certainly go back again. Ideal for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the claustrophobic!”
Reviews.Author: dingsterkat
Reviews.Content: This is a modern, botique hotel with great bathrooms. However, careful what type of room you book. I booked a nonsmoking room with a double bed, and found out upon check in that these rooms were only in interior hallways (no real windows) and I swear there was only two foot of space all the way around the bed. I don't have a bedroom in my house nearly that small! Also construction noise from next door was easily heard during the day at least: constant hammering and sawing. We upgraded to a superior room which did have exterior windows, but was pretty noisy from sirens at night. Also all exterior rooms have twin beds. The extra space however was not cheap - 40 euros additional a night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JamesG88
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our 3 nights stay in the Vincci Centrum. Its location was superb, with many attractions within short walking distance. The rooms were tastefully furnished and we had a very pleasant stay in Madrid. There is a quaint coffeehouse round the corner (towards Puerta del Sol direction) which served really good breakfast and churros too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jrwgas
Reviews.Content: Agree with all that people have said. Very classy, great location, helpful staff and although the rooms are a touch on the small, dark side, they are modern with a wonderful shower. Highly recommended at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: doghouse
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just as everyone has said previously. Great location, helpful friendly staff, trendy, comfortable rooms - but basins look good but not practical.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: hickers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in March this year. I was very warm weather, but the hotel room was a little oasis. The interior to the hotel was very stylish and modern, the reception staff very helpful (especially when I got food poisoning from a dodgy chicken sandwich from one of the outside restaurants near the Palace- beware!). The rooms are nice and cosy, some people might think dark, but they were lovely in the morning when you are recovering from too much fine food and wine! The shower was fab! The bathroom was the best thing about the rooms! On the whole, I would recommend this place to anyone staying in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: hawa
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for a better hotel than the Vincci Centrum. A 5 min. walk from Puerta del Sol, everything from restaurants to sightseeing was within easy walking distance. We had a room with a king size bed, which took up most of the space in the room, but the room was well-appointed and quiet. The bathroom was excellent with a fantastic shower. Staff were friendly and helpful. We had breakfast in the Cafe Hontanares just around the corner. A real find is the Vinoteca Barbechera on the corner of the Calle Principe and the Calle del Prado, about a 10 min. walk from the hotel. Great place for wine and tapas. We took the public bus to Toledo and a train to El Escorial. The metro stop is a short walk from the hotel. I would stay here again andi highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: JollyHollidayer
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 3 nights at the Vincci Centrum and would give this hotel 10 out of 10 for location. It's within an easy stroll to all of the main tourist destinations including the Royal Palaces (one end of town) and the art galleries (the other end). However, the hotel interior itself lost them the full five stars. Having stayed at the Vincci Maritimo in Barcelona, I was a little bit disappointed with the size of the room. Perfectly adequate, but all seemed a little bit cramped. Also, we got a room looking out onto a brick wall, therefore needed to use the lights in the room the whole time as this made the room even more pokey. Also, going in November you'd expect the weather to be cooler (which is was - averaging around 10-12oC), but the heating in the hotel was turned up full blast all of the time, which made for an uncomfortable nights sleep. Talking about uncomfortable sleeping arrangements, the pillows are fairly uncomfortable too - either too high, or too low. I couldn't get this right and ended up with a crick in my neck most of the time we were there!! On the upside though, the hotel is very modern and trendy, and spotlessly clean, with fantastic bathrooms (two sinks and an excellent shower) - and a nice lounge area downstairs for a chill out drink after a days sightseeing. Don't bother with breakfast in the hotel. There are plenty of nice places within a close proximity of the hotel at a fraction of the cost - we ended up at Ducados Cafe each morning and had a very nice coffee with Croissants (with english speaking staff, although if you do try a bit of Spanish it goes a long way!). Another good (and close) place to eat on an evening (if you're not keen on tapas) is Pizza Nostrum, Pasta Nostrum. Amazing pizzas, and very reasonable. Enjoy Madrid - it's an amazing City that I would definately visit again, and would probably stay at the Vincci due to the excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “central hotel”
Reviews.Author: henrywebber
Reviews.Content: overall, the hotel was very tendy and well presented. our room was small and the dark interior made it feel smaller and it was not laid out well cable was limited to CNN - no UK channels breakfast was expensive if you just wanted tea and toast - no middle ground great location - but currently they are renovating next door ( i believe) and there was building noise from early in the morning cab from the airport is 19 euros
